snippet.title: Palaszczuk's popularity in decline: poll
snippet.content: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's personal popularity has fallen to its lowest ever level just months out from the next state election. A new Galaxy Poll commissioned by The Sunday Mail shows Ms Palaszczuk's satisfaction rating has fallen from 47 per cent to 39 per cent, though Opposition Leader Tim Nicholls' satisfaction rating remains stranded at 27 per cent. Ms Palaszczuk's Labor party retains a 51 per cent to 49 per cent lead over the Liberal National Party ahead of the next poll, which is due by early next year but could be called in late 2017. (C) AAP 2017
